DOC.brief_summary: Randomised , placebo-controlled dose-response intervention study vitamin D3 pregnant woman .
DOC.brief_title: Nutritional Requirements Vitamin D Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: This four-arm , parallel , double-blind , placebo-controlled dose-response intervention study vitamin D3 . Women recruit first trimester followed-up throughout pregnancy . White woman randomise receive placebo , 10 20 mcg/d vitamin D3 baseline visit first trim delivery . Dark skin woman receive 20 mcg/d . Blood sample take trimester also cord delivery . A 25-hydroxyvitamin D concentration 30 nmol/L use denote clinical deficiency 50 nmol/L indicate sufficient vitamin D status . Information maternal anthropometry , diet , lifestyle , sun exposure , blood pressure serum total calcium also report .
DOC.criteria: Adult ( > 18 year ) No 18 week gestation In good general health Low risk pregnancy Not consume > 10 mcg/d vitamin D supplement Current smoker Diagnosed hypertension Known highrisk pregnancy Diagnosed medical illness include diabetes mellitus ( Types 1 & 2 ) , chronic kidney disease gastrointestinal diseases illness know interfere calcium metabolism ( e.g . sarcoidosis ) . Consumption medication know interfere vitamin D metabolism Consumption vitamin D ( ≥ 10 µg/day ) calcium ( ≥ 650 mg/d ) supplement prior randomization
